block.p: Catharina Wrede, the daughter of Lindsey Holaday of New Haven and Stuart Wrede of Guilford, Conn., was married yesterday to Nicholas Geoffrey Braden, a son of Rosemary and Christopher Braden of London. The Rev. Ralf Lindstrom, a Lutheran minister, performed a nondenominational ceremony at the summer home of the bride's family in Perna, Finland.

Until May, the bride, 24, and the bridegroom, 30, were consultants in Moscow for McKinsey & Company. They are moving to Boston, where the bridegroom will join the McKinsey office in September. The bride will begin studying for a doctorate in political science at Harvard University as a Jacob K. Javits scholar. She graduated cum laude from Yale University. Her father, an architect in Guilford, was the director of the architecture and design department at the Museum of Modern Art in New York from 1986 to 1992. Her mother is the associate director for strategic planning at Yale in New Haven.

Catharina Wrede, the daughter of Lindsey Holaday of New Haven and Stuart Wrede of Guilford, Conn., was married yesterday to Nicholas Geoffrey Braden, a son of Rosemary and Christopher Braden of London. The Rev. Ralf Lindstrom, a Lutheran minister, performed a nondenominational ceremony at the summer home of the bride's family in Perna, Finland.

Until May, the bride, 24, and the bridegroom, 30, were consultants in Moscow for McKinsey & Company. They are moving to Boston, where the bridegroom will join the McKinsey office in September. The bride will begin studying for a doctorate in political science at Harvard University as a Jacob K. Javits scholar. She graduated cum laude from Yale University. Her father, an architect in Guilford, was the director of the architecture and design department at the Museum of Modern Art in New York from 1986 to 1992. Her mother is the associate director for strategic planning at Yale in New Haven.

The bridegroom graduated from Oxford University and received a master's degree in Russian studies from Harvard and an M.B.A. from Insead, the business school in Fontainebleau, France. His father is a partner in L'Occitane, the cosmetics company in Paris.
